## Social Vulnerability Index (SVI)

|  |  |
|-------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| **Description** | The [Social Vulnerability Index](https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/place-health/php/svi/index.html) uses 15 U.S. census variables to help local officials identify communities that may need support before, during, or after disasters. |
| **Time Frame** | Year; 2000, 2010, 2014, 2016, 2018, 2020, 2022 |
| **Spatial Scale** | County and Census Tract |
| **Format** | CSV and Geodatabase |
| **Source** | Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) |
| **Original Repository** | [All Years](https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/place-health/php/svi/svi-data-documentation-download.html) |
| **Living Atlas** | [2018](https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=cbd68d9887574a10bc89ea4efe2b8087) [2020](https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=05709059044243ae9b42f469f0e06642) [2022](https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=414c0b43a0ec4adc829d5815bc621750) |

: {tbl-colwidths="\[20,80\]"}

**Details**\
Ranking by social vulnerability. Can look at rank within a state or within the entire US. A composite measure based on four dimensions:

-   Housing Type and Transportation
-   Household Composition and Disability
-   Socioeconomic Status
-   Minority Status and Language

Can also map by individual dimension.
